Description.p: Information about an academic department within a provider, e.g. Maths Department.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the academic department.
Free text description providing more detail about the academic department.
The providerthis academic department resides in.
A list of the staff members that belong to the academic department.
A list of the courses the academic department manages.
A list of the subject areas the academic department manages.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Provides information about a particular assignment or other assessment task, to be undertaken by one or more Students at some time. Defines the task separately from each student's attempting the task.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the assessment task.
A list of the education providers organisations involved, and their role, e.g. assessing provider, assessment provider, assessment location provider.

The TeachingGroup object in which this assignment has been set. If this reference id is not present, then the assessment task is set for all students in the StudentList. Either StudentList or TeachingGroupRefId must be specified.
The provider course data object the assessment task is set as part of.

A list of references identifying the students that this assessment task has been set for. If this list is empty or not present, then the assessment task is set for all students in the referenced TeachingGroup. Either StudentList or TeachingGroupRefId must be specified.
A list of the staff involved and their role in relation to the assessment task, e.g. the staff member that created the assessment task, the moderator.
The text-based description of the assessment task.
The total Raw points possible on the assessment task.
Date the assessment task is due.
The weight of the assessment task, in its contribution to course or segment over-all grade.
How many attempts the student is allowed on the assignment (applicable particularly to online activities).
The location of the document that describes the assessment task. Preferred against DetailedDescriptionBinary for online assessment.
The type of assessment.

Code denoting the nature of the assessment process; Primary assessment against NZ Curriculum or Te Marautanga o Aotearoa; Secondary assessment against NCEA, Cambridge, International Baccalaureate, or similar.
The type of assessment evaluation, e.g. formative or summative.
The curriculum the assessment is for.
The assessment tool the assessment is used as part of. Both the original free text value sent by the SMS vendors and the value it is mapped to in this code set are held.
The tests available within an assessment tool that is being used by this assessment task.
Text description of the assessment purpose.
AssessmentTasks which this assessment task is composed of.

Prerequisite conditions to be met for assessment, a set of identifiers and the name of each Prerequisite, which may be a LearningStandard, AssessmentTask, SchoolCourse or any other recognised SIF data object.
A list of the subject areas being assessed.

The year level the Assessment Task pertains to. May only contain the values 0 through to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
A list of references and name identifying the LearningStandards being assessed by the assessment task.
The type of standard the assessment task is for. Applies to secondary level assessments, e.g. unit and achievement standards, scholarships and International Baccalaureate.
A list of Special Assessment Conditions that are not allowed to be used on this particular AssessmentTask - even if the Student has been approved for using those SACs for the nominated academic year.
The timeframe of the assessment, e.g. Mid-Year, End of Year.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

A qualification or other award granted by a national body, professional association or other interested party. The Credential describes an award that is made to the learner at the successful completion of a particular learning programme. eg: NCEA Level 1; University Entrance; NCEA Level 2 Chemistry;
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.

Code assigned by the Credential administrator to identify the CreLocalIddential. This may not uniquely identify the Credential, where there may be multiple editions or versions of a particular Credential. The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the Credential. eg: "NCEA Level 1"
The version of the Credential.
The EducationOrganisation that administers the Credential. eg, NZQA, Cambridge International Education, etc.
Description of the Credential
The standard MoE Learning / Subject Areas that this Credential is part of.
A code denoting the current status of the Credentialas set by the Administrator.
The date the Credential was published, and offered.
The date the administering organization superceded the Credential.
The date the administering organization discontinued the Credential
The number of course (or other qualification) credits that will be achieved by passing this Credential.
The level of the credential if applicable, e.g. NCEA Level 1.

The list of specific LearningStandards that must be 'passed' in order to attain the Credential. Only used where a Credential is gained by successfully passing a number of particular identifiable LearningStandards.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Location and meta-data of a document, including evidentiary documents, personalised plans, and action plans.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The organisation that created this document, or entered it into the system.
Description of Location of Document; as document may not be stored with URL.
The title of the document.
What the document is and how it is related to the Student.
The date and time the document was added.
Document Review Date.
URL if known.
If the type of document is 'Note' then this is populated with the free text that makes up the note.
A list of objects that this document relates to, e.g. a Wellbeing Response or Characteristic, Physical Restraint.
The classification of the document to give an indication of the audience who should have access.
The type of document, e.g. Personalised Plan, Wellbeing Event or Response supporting documentation.
The people associated to a document and their role in relation to it, e.g. author, owner, reviewer, subject of.
The date of the document, e.g. the date the document was produced.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

A curriculum standard or the like published by a national body, professional association or other interested party. The LearningStandard describes a set of learning that students are expected to undertake.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.

Code assigned by the LearningStandard publisher to identify the LearningStandard. This may not uniquely identify the LearningStandard, where there may be multiple editions or versions of a particular LearningStandard. The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the LearningStandard. eg: "Demonstrate understanding of chemical reactivity"

A unique number that is used to identify the learning standard. One use of this is for NZQA standard numbers which cannot be used as a unique identifier (in LocalId) on their own as they are versioned so are part of a composite key with VersionNo.
The version of the LearningStandard.
The EducationOrganisation that published the LearningStandard
The type of standard e.g., unit standard, achievement standard or scholarship.
The family the learning standard is part of.
Description of the standards document.
The standard MoE Learning / Subject Areas this LearningStandard is part of.
A code denoting the current status of the LearningStandard, as set by the Publisher.
The date the publishing organization superceded the LearningStandard.
The date the LearningStandard was published.
The date the publishing organization discontinued the LearningStandard.
The number of course (or other qualification) credits that will be achieved by passing this LearningStandard.
The level of the learning standard.
Code denoting how the LearningStandard is assessed.
A list of related LearningStandards
A list of credentials that the learning standard contributes to attaining.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Records a relationship between Organisations: 1. Contributor & Receiver between ECE, Primary, Intermediate & Secondary Schools, and Tertiary. 2. Client & Host between Schools for provision of particular classes (eg. Tech Centre, class by Correspondence) etc. 3. Between Communities of Learning and Schools. 4. Between Local Offices and Providers. 5. Between Learning Support Clusters and Schools or ECEs. 6. Between RTLB clusters and providers.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.

The status of the relationship between the two organisations. Set to Active when: EffectiveDate => today's date and ExpirationDate is NULL or ExpirationDate > than today's date. Set to Inactive when: EffectiveDate < today's date or ExpirationDate =< today's date.
Code describing the nature of the relationship between the source and related organisations.
The source Organisation in the relationship.
The role the source organisation is playing in this relationship.
The date the source provider's agreement to the provider relationship was recorded. This field may only be written by the source provider.
The related Organisation in the relationship.
The role the related organisation is playing in this relationship.
The date the related Provider's agreement to the provider relationship was recorded. This field may only be written by the related provider.
The date after which the relationship will be in effect
The date after which the relationship will no longer be in effect
The list of year levels that apply to this relationship.
For contributor/feeder relationship, it is a single value being the last year of schooling for learners at the contributor provider.
For client/host relationship it is multiple values being the year levels of the students that are sent to the host provider.
The list of subject areas/learning areas that apply to this relationship.
For contributor/feeder relationship, it will not be present.
For client/host relationship it is multiple values being the the subjects / learning areas of the classes conducted at the host provider.
Free text description providing more detail about the provider relationship.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Education Provider entities (ECEs, Schools &amp; Tertiary Education Institutions), Communities (Kāhui Ako, Learning Support Clusters, etc.), and others (Teen Parent Units, Activity Centres. etc.)
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.

The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from. For organisations imported from FIRST this is the FIRST orgId- which is different from the MoE Org Number.
The set of postal and other addresses that the Organisation uses
A method of communication with the organisation.
A list of one or more cotact persons related to the organisation
A region of New Zealand defined by the Ministry of Education for administrative purposes
The special education district the provider belongs to.
The set of contact email addresses that the Organisation uses
The opening date of the Organisation. For proposed or approved organisations this will be the projected opening date.
Closing date of the Organisation. Only present for closed providers
The normal business name of the Organisation
The set of contact phone numbers that the Organisation uses
A list of other organisations that are related to the Provider
Current status of the Provider
The reason the operational status of the organisation was changed.
Describes the nature of the Organisation; for Schools this indicate the schooling levels offered.
Code denoting the role the organisation plays within the education sector, e.g. School Sector Institution, Learning Support Cluster, etc.
A code denoting the authority by which the Provider is authorised to provide education services.
Indicates whether or not an ECE Service Provider Organisation is a Licenced ECE Service Provider.
Indicates whether or not an ECE Service Provider Organisation is a Playgroup Service Provider.
The type of ECE Service Provider ownership, e.g. Sole Trader, Company, Charitable Trust etc.
Only present if the Provider is a provider of school education services. Contains properties that are school-specific.
Only present if the Provider is a provider of early childhood education (ECE) services. Contains properties that are early learning specific.
Only present if the Provider is a provider of tertiary education services. Contains properties that are tertiary education specific.
The name of the School Management System (SMS) that the provider is currently using. Note: not all education providers use an SMS.
Provides iinformation specific to Te Rito, e.g. which functionality in Te Rito an organisation (school, ECE etc.) is utilising.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Provides information about a calendaring event that occurs on the provider's calendar, visible to all users associated with that provider, e.g. Athletics Day.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The organisation the provider calendar event is for.
The date and time the provider's calendar event starts.
The date and time the provider's calendar event ends.
The name of the provider's event happening at this date and time.
Free text denoting the location the event is occurring at.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
This object is for course information.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The Provider that is offering the Course.
Code denoting which half of the National Curriculum the Course has been designed to.
Subject matter areas.
A list of instructional year levels that the course applies to.
Title of the course.
Textual description of the course and its content.
The number of weeks of instruction this Course requires.
The number of credits awarded upon course completion.
Which language(s) is the Course taught in, and for how many hours per week?
Indicator to advise NZQA that course does not have sufficient credits for endorsement.
A list of references to LearningStandard data objects that students are assessed against as part of the Course
A list of credentials that the learning standard contributes to attaining.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

An academic day that makes up all or part of a schedule for an organisation. An academic day represents a type of structured day that reoccurs consistently e.g. Day A has five periods that occurs Mon-Wed and Day B has four periods and occurs Thurs-Fri.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the Academic Day.
The organisation the academic day belongs to.
The organisation schedule the academic day belongs to.
The period times in the schedule the academic day is following.
A list of the periods that make up this academic day, e.g. Period 1, Period 2 etc.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Provides information about what schedule is being followed on a specific calendar date, e.g. Academic Day A from the Term 1 Schedule using the Periods and their start and end times defined in Bell Schedule Day A.
The organisation, e.g. school, tertiary institution etc., that this schedule date record belongs to.
The Schedule within the organisation to which this ScheduleDate applies.
A list of calendar dates and the period times, academic day and terms that applies to each day within the schedule.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

This is used to define a single day exception to the normal schedule on a specific calendar date. It can be used to define one-off single day ScheduleDayPeriodTimes for special event days or apply unexpected school cancellations (such as a weather cancellation) without having to define a new formal ScheduleDayPeriodTimes object or rework the entirely of the remaining schedule, also it can be used to define otherwise illegal overlays of academic days that do not conform to the normal schedule pattern. It does not affect any changes to the set of ScheduleDate entries; that are caused by the exception being recorded. If an exception changes the rotation; then the ScheduleDate entity for the affected Schedule must be updated (for the entire schedule period/calendar year) to reflect the impact of the ScheduleException.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The organisation in which the exception to the schedule will occur.
A schedule that is being affected by the schedule exception.
The date of the exception to the schedule.
A list of one or more academic days that are to be applied for the duration of this exception. Not present if the Provider is closed for the duration of the ScheduleException.

A list of the periods that make up the period time schedule and their start and end times for the duration of this event. Not present if the Provider is closed for the duration of the ScheduleException.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Defines period time schedules, each of which is a collection of periods within an academic day with start and end times associated. These period time schedules are assigned to calendar dates on which the organisation is in session using ScheduleDate in order to specify the organisation schedule on those dates. These period time schedules should generally only be used to define standard day types. Exception days (unless they repeat multiple times and follow a common template) are defined using ScheduleException.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the Period Time Schedule, e.g. Regular.
The education provider or organisation the period time schedule belongs to.
The organisation schedule the period time schedule relates to.
A list of the periods that make up the period time schedule and their start and end times.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Defines the periods that take place within one or more academic days
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the period.
The organisation in which this scheduled period occurs.
The schedule that this schedule period belongs to within the organisation. Organisations can have multiple schedules.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Provides information about school terms, tertiary terms etc., either at a national, or organisation level, within a school year. If the term is being supplied at a national level, no organisation information will be linked.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the term, e.g. Term 1.
The organistion, e.g. school, tertiary institution etc, that the term information is for. Organisation information is not supplied when the term information is at a national level.

The school year the Term is part of. May be either a single year or across multiple years e.g. schools using the Maramataka calendar start the school year in June or July thus the school year would be 2021-2022.
The start date of the Term
The end date of the Term
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
A schedule an organisation has in place to manage their timetable.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The name of the schedule.
The start date of the schedule.
The end date of the schedule.
The organisation the schedule is for.
The list of the academic days defined in this schedule.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Records assignment of a Staff member to a particular Role at a Provider or other EducationOrganisation. A Staff member can have multiple concurrent roles at Schools (via Provider data object) and Kahui Ako (via the EducationOrganisation data object); each role would be a separate StaffAssignment record.

Role assignments can be restricted to categories of Students with the StaffSubjectList and YearLevelList. This allows for assignment to roles with particular responsibility for general cohorts of students, such as "Head of Department (Maths)" or "Year 8 Student Dean".

While assignment to student contact roles such as Subject Teacher, Homeroom Teacher, Whānau Teacher, or House Master is made with this data object; Details of the particular groups of specific students the staff member is responsible for are made via the TeachingGroup data object.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
States whether or not this is an inactive or active assignment for a staff member.
The staff memberwho is assigned to the location, as represented in the StaffPersonal object.
A generic object reference to the Provider that the staff member is assigned to.
Indicates whether or not this is the staff member's employing/accommodating provider. Only applies to staff members assigned to schools.
Short description of the staff member's assignment to the provider.
The role the staff member holds at the provider.
The date from which the staff assignment is valid (inclusive).
This is the date through which the staff assignment is valid (inclusive). This can be NULL when the staff member's assignment to a particular role is open-ended.
Indicates whether or not this teacher is a casual relief teacher CRT.
Status of staff member within this school. Where a Staff member is employed by an organisation that covers more than one school, employment status may be different at each school.
The set of SubjectArea/LearningAreas the that the staff member is responsible for. e.g. "Head of Dept (Maths)" includes students learning any flavour of Mathematics.
The set of student Year Levels that the staff member is responsible for. e.g. "Junior Student Dean" could have responsibility for all students in year levels 9 & 10.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
All the personal, contact and demographic information relating to a staff member, who might be a teacher or other employee of a Provider.
Non-personal information relating to the staff member's relationship with Providers is stored in the StaffAssignment data object.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The unique identifier used by ESL to identify the school staff member.
The unique identifier used by the staff member's school to identify the school staff member.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Provides information about a staff members assignment to a teaching group.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.

The status of the staff's teaching group assignment. Set to Active when: StartDate => today's date and EndDate is NULL or EndDate > than today's date. Set to Inactive when: StartDate < today's date or EndDate =< today's date.
The staff member that is being assigned to the teaching group.
The organisation the teaching group is being run by.
The teaching group the staff member is being assigned to.
The role the staff member is performing within the teaching group, e.g. Teacher, Teacher Aide, Student Teacher.
The date the staff member was assigned to the teaching group in this role.
The date the staff member stopped being assigned to the teaching group in this role.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Provides information on a co-curricular or extra-curricular activity in which a student participates during a given school year.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student participating in the activity.
The organisation running the activity the student is participating in, e.g. schools.
Code denoting the group of the activity the student is participating in, e.g. sport, art, cultural, music.
Code denoting the type of activity the student is participating in, e.g. rugby, drama, Kapa Haka, Violin.
The name of the activity the student participated in.
The learning area the student activity the student is participating in relates to.
Comment related to the student's participation in the activity.
This is the date from which the activity participation is valid (inclusive).
This is the date through to which the activity participation is valid (inclusive).
Specific role the student plays in the activity (e.g., band leader, student body president).
List of awards and other types of recognition given to the student for this activity.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
The student's registration for an assessment task they are intending to participate in.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The status of the student's registration for an assessment task, e.g. applied, approved, withdrawn.
A list of the education providers and organisations involved, and their role, e.g. assessing provider, assessment provider, assessment location provider.
The student held in the StudentPersonal data object whose intention to participate in an assessment task is being registered.
The staff member who registered the student's intention to participate in the assessment task.
The AssessmentTask data object that the registration is for.
NZQA specific registration details. Used for registrations made to NZQA only.
A list of references identifying any Special Assessment Conditions that the student is entitled to for the assessment task they are registering for.
The ProviderCourse that this assessment task registration belongs to.
Generic object reference to the LearningStandard the student is registering for.
Code denoting the Learning or Subject Area the assessment task registration is for.

The Year Level of the assessment task the registration is for. May only contain the values 0 through to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
The date the student's intent to participate in the assessment task was registered.
The assessment year the student's intent to participate in the assessment task was registered for.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Records the result achieved by a single student for a particular assessment task.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student's NZQA entry Id provided upon confirmation of the student's registration to be assessed against a unit or achievement standard. Identifies what entry the result is for to NZQA.
Reference to the AssessmentTask the student was assessed against and the result is for.
Reference to the StudentAssessmentTask data object that the assessment result belongs to.
The student held in the StudentPersonal data object whose assessment task result this is.
The type of assessment the result is for.

Code denoting the nature of the assessment process; Primary assessment against NZ Curriculum or Te Marautanga o Aotearoa; Secondary assessment against NCEA, Cambridge, International Baccalaureate, or similar.
A list of the education providers and organisations involved, and their role, e.g. assessing provider, assessment provider, assessment location provider.
A list of the staff involved and their role in relation to the assessment task, e.g. the moderator, the marker.
Reference to the ProviderCourse that this assessment task belongs to.
A list of references to the LearningStandards the assessment task result is related to.
A list of the subject areas that the assessment pertains to.

The Year Level of the student when they were assessed by this Assessment Task. May only contain the values 0 through to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
The curriculum the assessment if for.
The type of assessment tool used for the assessment task. Both the original free text value sent by the SMS vendors and the value it is mapped to in this code set are held.
The tests available within an assessment tool that is being used by this assessment task.
The timeframe of the assessment, e.g. Mid-Year, End of Year.
The attempt number the student is making to pass this assessment, e.g. is it their first, second attempt.
The type of assessment evaluation, e.g. formative or summative.
The type of standard the result is for. Applies to secondary level assessments, e.g. unit and achievement standards, scholarships and International Baccalaureate.
The date the assignment was marked.
The date the student was assessed against this assessment task.
The date the student was notified of their final mark for the assessment task.
Confirmation from NZQA that they have received the result record for the student.
Indicates whether or not the result has been published.
The date the assessment task result was first published in a report.
The iteration of this result for the assessment, e.g. some tasks require multiple assessments before being achieved.
The number of credits the student achieved.
A list of the assessment result scores that the student received for this assessment task.
The weight of the assessment task result, in its contribution to the course or segment over-all grade.
Free text comment about the effort the student made for the assessment.
Free text comments providing additional information for the students assessment result.
Any documents relevant to the assessment task result.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Record of a student's attempt at a particular assessment task.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student held in the StudentPersonal data object who is being assessed against the assessment task.
The AssessmentTask data object that the student assessment is for.
The registration made on behalf of the student by the school to sit this assessment.
A list of the education providers and organisations involved and their role, e.g. assessing provider, assessment provider, assessment location provider.
A list of the staff involved and their role in relation to the assessment task, e.g. the staff members that supervise the undertaking of the assessment task by the student.
The date and time the student is scheduled to be assessed against the assessment task.
The date and time the student was assessed against the assessment task.
The status of the assessment, e.g. Marked, Moderated.
Date the current NCEA Assessment Status was set.
The attempt number the student is making to pass this assessment, e.g. is it their first, second attempt.
The list of the special assessment conditions that the student is entitled to have when sitting this assessment task.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Records a student gaining an Attainment e.g. NCEA Qualification, Learning Standard etc.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The organisation who is granting the attainment to the student, e.g. NZQA, TEC.
Generic object refererence to the actual Credential, LearningStandard, ProviderCourse or other object being attained.
The name of the attainment actually conferred; e.g. "NCEA Level 2 in Chemistry, endorsed with Merit"
The student who the attainment is for.
The staff member who authorised the attainment.
The date the student achieved the attainment. Either the DateAttained or the YearAttained must be present.
The year the student achieved the attainment. Either the DateAttained or the YearAttained must be present.
A list of references identifying the assessment task results that justify the student achieving this attainment.
A list of Subject Areas the attainment pertains to.
The level of NCEA or Course endorsement the student received for the attainment.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Provides a summary of a student's daily attendance and membership information for a given provider during the time period between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive. There will be multiple instances of this object for a student in a school over the course of a school year. This summary may be generated by aggregating more granular attendance records, in which case all fields will be read-only; and RefId element may not be applicable.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student for whom this attendance information is being reported.
The organisation (e.g. school) for which this attendance information is being reported.

The school year for which this attendance summary applies. May be either a single year or across multiple years e.g. schools using the Maramataka calendar start the school year in June or July thus the school year would be 2021-2022.
Starting date of this attendance reporting period.
Ending date of this attendance reporting period.
Number of the school day represented in StartDate.
Number of the school day represented in EndDate.
Full time equivalent numeric value of the student's course load during this attendance period, expressed in decimal form, where 1.00 represents a full time enrollment.

The percentage of half days the student was present when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive. Number of Sessions Present / Total Number of possible sessions = Percentage, e.g. 294/319 = 92.2%.
The percentage of half days the student had unjustified absences when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive.
The number of half days the student was present when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive.
The number of half days the student was absent when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive.
The number of half days the student was absent that were justified when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive.
The total number of half days.

The number of days the student was absent from school for an unjustifiable reason when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive, and weren't absence for the complete half-day.
The percentage of half days the student was present when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive.
The number of days the student was absent from school for an unjustifiable reason when school was in session between the StartDate and EndDate, inclusive.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Information about a piece of consent given, or a piece of consent not given by the student.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student the consent is for.
The organisation or provider that the consent was given to.
The staff member that recorded the consent.
What the student is consenting or not consenting to.
Indicates whether or not consent was given.
The role of the person who gave consent on behalf of the student, e.g. Whānau, Learner.
The date the consent or no consent was given.
The date the consent was revoked, if it was given.
Another data object that relates to this consent, e.g. the student enrolment record this consent was captured as part of.
Additional free text information provided about the consent.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Contains all the personal information about a person who is a part of a Student's whānau.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.

The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.Note: LocalId may be used as a unique person identifier rather than a unique contact identifier. In this case there may be more than one StudentContactPersonal instance with the same LocalId.
Indicates if the Student Contact has a Board of Trustees Vote in respect of a certain school.
Personal Information
Detail of the health care service when the contact is a medical pratitioner.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

A relationship between a person who is a part of a Student's whānau and that Student. Relationship properties include the relationship type and roles played by the student contact in respect of the student.
Individual details about the student and the student contact are provided in other data objects - StudentPersonal and StudentContactPersonal respectively.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The status of the relationship between the student and their contact.
The date the relationship between the student and contact was recorded.
The date the relationship between the student and contact was removed.
The student the contact relationship is for.
The contact person for the student.
The organisation associated with the relationship.
Defines the relationship of the contact to the student.
The language the student and their contact use to communicate.
A list of households associated with the relationship

Contains Yes/No characteristics of the contact person's role. Provide a Yes value for all that apply. At least one of the child elements of ContactFlags must have a Yes value. Do not publish the StudentContactRelationship instance if one of the child elements does not have a Yes value.
Number indicating the order in which the person should be contacted.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
A single curriculum progress and achievement report provided for a student. Used in technology centres the host provider, to report on student progress to their base school.
May be extended in the future to cover reporting on other curriculum areas.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student the technology centre progress and achievement report is for.
The technology centre organisation.
Generic object reference to the technology group the student is enrolled in.
A list of the staff members that compiled the progress report. A report can be authored by a collective of individual class teachers, or may be compiled by a single author.
The date the repository received the students technology centre progress and achievement report.
The timeframe of the provided information e.g. Routine Update, Mid-Year, End of Year etc.
A list of records of the Student's progress in particular classes from the Technology curriculum. e.g. Hard Materials, Food Technology, Digital Design etc.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Contains information about a response provided for a studen'ts learning support need.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student that the learning support need response its for.
The organisation that created this learning support need reponse.
The learning support need the reponse is for. Links to WellbeingCharacteristic.
The type of response provided to the student to support the need.
Additional detail about the response type provided to the student to support the need.
The date the response is due to be reviewed.
The goals of the response in relation to the student's learning support need.
Free text notes about the response.
A list of notes that have been written about the learning support response.
Free text description about the response type and detail. Mandatory when a response detail of 'Other' is selected.
The tier of response for the learning support need response.
Additional information for an internal response.
Additional information for an external response.
A list of the reviews made about the response.
A list of attachments associated to the learning support need response.
The date the response was completed.
The outcome of the response.
Free text comment about the outcome of the response made for the students learning support need.
The status of the learning support need response when it is closed.
Additional detail about the responses closure status.
Free text notes about the completion of the response to the students learning support need.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Ties together the components that make up a student's learning support record, such as their needs, responses and reviews to those needs, consent provided by the student and the whether or not the student is currently being supported.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student the learning support record is for.
The organisation that created the learning support record for the student.
The learners learning support status, e.g. are they currently being managed or not.
The date the learner's learning support status was changed from Active to Archived.
A list of the consents the student has provided / not provided in regards to learning support, e.g. Cluster Sharing COnsent, Recieve Service Consent.
Indicates whether or the student has been assessed using dyslexia screening tools.
Indicates whether or not the student has under gone any other type of screening.
Free text describing any other type of screening the student has undergone. Mandatory if 'OtherScreening' = 'Y'.

Indicates whether or not the student has undergone an adolescent health screening, e.g. NZ Aotearoa Adolescent Health and development (NZAAHD) assessment, HEEADDSS (Home, Education/employment, Eating, Activities, Drugs and Alcohol, Sexuality, Suicide/depression, Safety).
Indicates whether or not the student has not been attending the education provider they are enrolled at.
Indicates whether or not the student is new to New Zealand.
Indicates whether or not the student has changed education providers reasonably frequently.
Indicates whether or not the student has undergone a B4 School Check.
Indicates whether or not there is other family context that pertains to the student and their needs.
Additional free text detail about any family context that pertains to the student and their needs. Mandatory if OtherStudentContext = 'Y'.
A list of the student's or their whānau's voice about their learning support in regards to the student 's interests, goals, and voice (comments, opinions).
A list of learning support needs that have been identified for the student.
Free text that describes the interests a learner has when they have had learning support needs identified.
Free text describing any goals the student wants to achieve, or any goals their whānau want them to achieve.
Free text capturing the learners and/or their whānaus opinions and point of view in regards to the learning support they are receiving.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
This object contains all the personal information related to the student.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.

The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from. This identifier may be set for each student independently for each provider. Each identifier is only available to be retrieved or maintained by the provider that created it.
The unique identifier allocated to every student in New Zealand, also known as the NSN.
NZQA's unique identifier for a student who has been registered for assessments to be conducted against the NZQA framework to achieve unit/achievement standards and national qualifications.
The date a student first ever started schooling in New Zealand. This field is used to establish most students’ Funding Year Level.
A summary of the type and quantity of early childhood education the student received before enrolling in their first school.
The personal details of a student.
The reason that the persons biographic data was changed.
Notes about a students care and custody status.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Provides information about an incident where staff members or other parties used physical restraint on a child.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The provider under whose supervision the student was, at the time the physical restraint incient occured.
The student to whom the physical restraint was applied.
The Principal or their delegate who oversaw the recording of the physical restraint incident.
The Wellbeing Event created for the student the physical reatrint was used on.
Free text description on why the physical restraint of the student was considered necessary.
Indicates whether or not this was the first time the student was restrained.
The date the physical restraint was used on the student.
Free text description of the location the physical restraint of the student occurred in.
Any other comments on the physical restraint incident.
The date the use of physical restraint on the student was report.
The time the physical restraint started being used.
The time the physical restraint stopped being used.
The reason the physical restraint was applied to the child.
Describes the Location of any associated documents kept in relation to this physical restraint incident.
A list of the people that witnessed the physical constraint.
A list of the people who administered the physical restraint to the student.
The list of the people and/or property that the student, who was restrained, was directing their behaviour at.
A list of the reflections made by the staff members who applied the physical restraint.
A list of the debriefings that took place after the physical restraint incident occurred.
A list of questions and their answers about the physical restraint incident.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
A student’s association with an education provider for the purpose of receiving educational services.
Provider enrolments span multiple-years with the ProviderEnrolment containing one or more ECE, School or Tertiary Enrolment sub-objects for each particular year.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student the enrolment at this provider is for.
The provider the student enrolment is for.
A unique identifier assigned to a Student for a period of enrolment by a provider. This may or may not be the same value as the EnrolmentLocalId.
The date of the student’s first attendance at the provider which should be the date from when this enrolment is ACTIVE. If future dated, then the intended first attendance date of the enrolment.
This is the date of a student’s last attendance at the provider which should also be the date from when this enrolment is WITHDRAWN.
The status of the enrolment
Details of the reasons, and interventions leading up to the student's enrolment being terminated.
The list of the types of early childhood education the parent told a primary school that the student received and the hours per week and/or day the student attended.
Properties of an enrolment in an early childhood service (WiP)
Holds the school enrolment details for a Students enrolment at a particular Provider for a particular academic year.
Properties of an enrolment in a tertiary education service (WiP)
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Defines a teaching group enrolment for a student.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.

The status of the student's teaching group enrolment. Set to Active when: StartDate => today's date and EndDate is NULL or EndDate > than today's date. Set to Inactive when: StartDate < today's date or EndDate =< today's date.
The student that is enrolled in the teaching group.
The organisation of the teaching group the student is enrolled in.
The teaching group the student is enrolled in.
The date the student's enrolment on the teaching group starts.
The date the student's enrolment on the teaching group ends.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Information about a student's interests and academic, career and social goals.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student to whom this StudentVoice record belongs.
Generic object reference to the Provider that recorded the Student Voice entry.
The type of student voice being record, e.g. their interests, goals, voice (comments, opinions).
Holds additional information relevant to the student's voice, that isn't an interest or goal.
A list of the student's interests.
A list of the student's social goals.
A list of the student's academic goals.
A list of the student's career goals.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Defines a single SchedulePeriod in a Schedule where the TeachingGroup meets.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The organisation in which the teaching group exists.
Generic object reference to the TeachingGroup that is meeting at the time and place specified in the event.
Unique ID of the schedule within the organisation that applies to this teaching group. A teaching group must draw scheduling information from only a single schedule.
The academic day on which this timetable event occurs.
The ID of the period in which this timetable event occurs.

A schedule term reference is used when an SMS does not define teaching group events by absolute dates, but only by terms. If you do not supply a term, it is assumed that the class will occur for the duration of the Schedule. If you do supply a Term, the class will only occur in that Term.
The Id of the room the teaching group is being taught in.
The name of the room the teaching group is being taught in.
Indicates whether or not attendance should be taken for this teaching group instance.
List of the teacher(s) teaching the class during this timetable event.
A list of courses that is being taught to the teaching group at this event.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Defines a teaching group meeting and the attendance of each student at that meeting. Meetings may either be scheduled or ad hoc.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The organisation that this teaching group meeting and recored attendance is for.
The teaching group the meeting information is being recorded for.
The date the teaching group meeting occurred.
The date and time the teaching group meeting attendance was submitted.
Defines details about an ad hoc meeting. When ad hoc meeting details are provided scheduled meeting details cannot be provided.
Defines details about a scheduled meeting. When scheduled meeting details are provided ad hoc meeting details cannot be provided.
A list of the students that attended the teaching group meeting and their recorded attendance.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Identifies a particular class or other group of students. Such groups can have multiple staff assigned in a variety of roles, may be assigned student from multiple year levels and may be taught multiple courses.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
Short free format label that describes the group.
Longer description if required.
Provides the means of identifying the type of group such as roll class or subject class for instance and treat them accordingly.
The organisation who defines the TeachingGroup. Either OrganisationRefId or OrganisationLocalId must be provided.
The organisation who actually teaches the TeachingGroup. Only present when the teaching organisation is not the defining organisation.
The term that the teaching groups run for, e.g. Term 1, Full Year etc.
List of Students in this Teaching Group
A List of teachers associated with the group – may or may not include the teacher timetabled in the schedule.
A list of Courses that are taught to the TeachingGroup
List of codes denoting the Learning or Subject Areas of the Course the TeachingGroup is being taught.
May not be included, if Schedule element is present.
For Subject Class teaching groups: the list of codes denoting the Year Levels of the Course the TeachingGroup is being taught.
For Roll Class teaching groups, the Year Levels of the students in the roll class group.

The current year level of the student, at the time the associated record was created. Valid values are 0 to 13 inclusive. Note: Year 0 students are new entrants that start primary school in the second half of the year, and move into Year 1 the following year.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Alert indicating to teachers and systems that this student has a 'concern' that needs to be known for 'duty of care', which could be Medical, Legal or other.
The alert may merely draw attention to Wellbeing Characteristics and Events, that contain more detail.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student to whom this WellbeingAlert belongs.
The provider for which this WellbeingAlert is being reported.
The staff member that is a key contact for this wellbeing alert.
The calendar date on which this Wellbeing Alert was published.
The date the Wellbeing Alert period commenced.
The date the Wellbeing Alert is due to finish.
The category of the Wellbeing Alert.
Description of this particular Wellbeing Alert.
A list of the providers and staff who have been sent the alerts and have acknowledged they have been read.
A list of key contacts for the alert.
A list of the Wellbeing Responses that contributed to the creation of this Wellbeing Alert.
A list of the Wellbeing Appeal outcomes that contributed to the creation of this Wellbeing Alert.
A list of the Wellbeing Characteristics that contributed to the creation of this Wellbeing Alert.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
Records detail of any “appeal” or a “request” made by involved parties in regard to a negative/punitive Wellbeing Response that was the result of a student Wellbeing Event.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The student to whom this WellbeingAppeal belongs.
The provider for which this WellbeingAppeal is being reported.
The WellbeingResponse for which this WellbeingAppeal is in response to.
The Alert this WellbeingAppeal's outcome has triggered.
The status of WellbeingAppeal.
The calendar date on which this WellbeingAppeal was registered.
Text relating to the particular WellbeingAppeal.
The outcome of the appeal.
The type of individual or group that determined the appeal outcome.
Describes the Location of any associated documents kept in relation to this Appeal.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Core Wellbeing Characteristic that is integral to the Student. This may be a Medical condition, special needs or a characteristic such as a known disability or any other characteristic or condition that is student specific and impacts their learning.
Some characteristics are already captured in the Demographics container of StudentPersonal however this object allows for more complex and targeted information.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student to whom this Wellbeing Characteristic belongs.
The provider which recorded this Wellbeing Characteristic.
Starting Date for this Characteristic to be noted.
End date for this Characteristic to be noted, if there is one.
Date at which this information should be reviewed.
Text relating to the particular WellbeingCharacteristic.
A list of notes that have been written about the wellbeing characteristic.
Top most category of WellbeingCharacteristic.
The Category of the Wellbeing Characteristic.
The Sub-Category of the Wellbeing Characteristic.

An additional layer to provide more detail around a wellbeing characteristic sub category. For examples for the learner’s support need sub category, e.g. if the support need of ‘Vision’ is selected for the user, the sub needs ‘Low Vision’ and ‘Blind’ are available to further define the type of vision issue the learner has. Not all support needs have sub needs.
Additional detail about a sub category.
The priority of the characteristic in relation to other characteristics within the same classification.
The Agency taking the lead on the learning support need case, e.g. MOE, Police, Corrections etc.)
Free text describing the Case Lead Agency when a Case Lead of 'Other' is selected.
The name of the contact person for the Case Lead Agency.
How the characteristic will be managed on a daily basis.
The emergency management plan in place.
The emergency response plan in place.
Any known triggers for the characteristic, e.g. social situations, activities, allergies.
Indicates whether or not this Wellbeing Characteristic needs to remain confidential.
Indicates whether or not this Wellbeing Characteristic needs to be raised as an Alert against the student.
A list of the medications required for this Wellbeing Characteristic.
Describes the Location of any associated documents kept in relation to this Characteristic.
A list of any Wellbeing Events that have arisen as a result of this Characteristic.
A list of any Wellbeing Alerts that have arisen as a result of this Characteristic.
A list of the special assessment conditions that a student is entitled to have when sitting an assessment.
The staus of the Wellbeing Characteristic.
Free text providing additional information about a medical need of a student. Especially when a medical need of 'Other' is selected.
Indicates whether or not the student has an official diagnosis that pertains to this Wellbeing Characteristic.
A list of official diagnoses that pertains to this wellbeing characteristic. At least one diagnosis is required if OfficialDiagnosis = 'Y'.
A list of the student's or their whānau's voice about their wellbeing characteristic in regards to the student 's interests, goals, and voice (comments, opinions).
Free text that describes the interests a learner has that pertains to this wellbeing Characteristic.
Free text describing any goals the student wants to achieve, or any goals their whānau want them to achieve that pertain to this wellbeing characteristic.
Free text capturing the learners and/or their whānaus opinions and point of view in regards to this wellbeing characteristic.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.

Record of an event happening that impacts on a school's duty of care to its students. The event record both ‘positive’ and ‘negative’ behaviours and is not just the recording of a discipline incident or an accident.

Where an event involves more than one student, a separate WellbeingEvent record is made for each involved Student, with all other involved students being recorded as InvolvedPersons in each-other's WellbeingEvent. e.g. Where the event is that a student punched another student, two WellbeingEvents will be recorded, one each for student, with the other recorded as a related person.

However, if a a student is reporting that another student fell off his bike, then the reporting student is listed as a person involved, in the single WellbeingEvent record made against the student who fell off his bike.
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student to whom this WellbeingEvent belongs.
The provider for which this WellbeingEvent is being reported.
The StudentPhysicalRestraint if it was administered to the student as part of this WellbeingEvent.
Text relating to the particular WellbeingEvent.
A list of the possible motivations that triggered the event.
Category class of the Wellbeing Event.
List of Categories of the WellbeingEvent.
The staff member who logged the Wellbeing Event record.
A list of the locations where the incident took place.
Free text description containing more details about the location in which the Wellbeing Event took place.
Date and time of the WellbeingEvent record creation.
The calendar date on which this WellbeingEvent occurred.
The time when WellbeingEvent occurred.
A description of the WellbeingEvent.
Time period of when the event occurred.
Flag indicating if the incident is confidential or not. If ‘Y’ should not be shared with any other system/school.
List of People involved in the Wellbeing event. Mandatory if more people than the student to which this event occurs is involved.
Current status of the Wellbeing Event.
A list of the problem behaviours identified for the student as a result of the Wellbeing Event.
If applicable the type of restraint that was used on the student during the Wellbeing Event.
A list of the actions taken as a result of this Wellbeing event.
Describes the Location of any associated documents kept in relation to this Response.
A Wellbeing Event gets created for every student involved in an event. This list links together all related Wellbeing Events.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
A record of the outcome and follow ups generated by a WellbeingEvent.
Some classes of WellbeingResponse such as stand-downs, suspensions, exclusions and expulsions must be reported to the Ministry;
The universally unique identifier for the data object record that is used across systems.
The Id of the data object record that was provided by the system that the information was originally sourced from.
The student to whom this WellbeingResponse belongs.
The provider for which this WellbeingResponse is being reported.
The calendar date on which this WellbeingResponse was published.
The date the WellbeingResponse period commenced.
The date the WellbeingResponse is due to finish.
The current status of the response to the wellbeing event.
Category of WellbeingResponse.
Text relating to the particular WellbeingResponse.
A person (additional to the student) involved in a Wellbeing Response where required to be known.
Container for details of a Suspension or Explusion.
Container for details of a Detention.
A list of the plans that are required for this Wellbeing Response.
Container for details of an Award.
Container for details of another type of Response.
Describes the Location of any associated documents kept in relation to this Response.
The Wellbeing Alert that was generated in response to this WellbeingResponse.
The WellbeingEvent this WellbeingResponse is for.
A list of any appeals that have been made in relation to this Wellbeing Response.
The audit details for a record, e.g. Created/Last Updated DateTime and Created/Last Updated By.
